business_idea: Baby and toddler sensory classes (0-36 months) offering multi-sensory experiences including music, light shows, tactile play, and messy-safe sensory stations. Classes are inspired by EYFS & Birth to 5 Matters frameworks. Based in Farnham, Surrey, UK with a dedicated sensory studio.
stage_summary: PRE-LAUNCH. Solo founder, trial classes completed (6-10 attendees per session), official launch in 2 weeks. 4 term bookings so far. Two class types active (Tiny Stargazers 0-6mo, Little Explorers 6-15mo). Active Adventurers planned but not yet mapped. Parties to be REMOVED from website. Instagram launched 2 days ago. Marketing is founder's #1 frustration — no experience. Long-term vision: franchise model across multiple towns.

interrogation_answers.fill_rates: Trial classes: 6-10 people per session. 4 term bookings so far. Official launch in 2 weeks.
interrogation_answers.financials: Unknown — hasn't officially launched yet. Pre-revenue.
interrogation_answers.acquisition_channels: Instagram (started 2 days ago), leaflets in local cafes, local hospital, nurseries. No digital marketing experience.
interrogation_answers.retention: Unknown — hasn't completed first term yet.
interrogation_answers.social_media_blocker: Just started Instagram 2 days ago. Only 1 post. Launch reel going out today. Not a deliberate absence — just brand new.
interrogation_answers.growth_ambitions: FRANCHISE model. Wants to be a 'renowned sensory and messy class' brand. Combine magical experiences with developmental milestones (EYFS). Eventually franchise to different towns. But fits around family life first.
interrogation_answers.coming_soon_timeline: Active Adventurers: not yet mapped, will open once current classes are full. Parties: REMOVE from website — not ready.
interrogation_answers.local_partnerships: None yet. Hasn't connected with health visitors, NCT groups, children's centres. Acknowledged it's a good idea and wants to start outreach.
interrogation_answers.competitor_switching: Spoke to mums from Baby Sensory. Good classes are always fully booked. Hartbeeps gets mixed feedback — 'too in your face', too much stimulation for babies. TW positioning as GENTLE sensory — mums feel connected, babies feel supported.
interrogation_answers.solo_operator_risk: Will run classes even when sick. Only cancels if hospitalised. Takes days off on weekends.
interrogation_answers.working_well: Class delivery — was nervous first few sessions but confident by 4th class. Great feedback from mums. Babies stayed engaged entire time. Classes ran smoothly.
interrogation_answers.frustrating: Marketing. No experience, doesn't know what she's doing. Feels overwhelmed by Instagram Reels, TikTok content, getting followers, driving website signups. This is her #1 pain point.

founders.name: Jade McDonough
founders.background: Co-Founder & CEO at Dexla (tech/product background). Started Tiny Whirlwinds after becoming a new mum and identifying a gap in sensory class provision in Farnham. Previously London-based with 500+ LinkedIn connections.

product_status.biggest_product_gap: Only 2 of 4 class types are currently running (Active Adventurers and Parties marked 'Coming Soon'). Limited schedule (Mon/Thu/Fri only).
ux_observations: Clean, professional website with clear class descriptions and pricing
Booking handled via external Pembee platform (tinywhirlwinds.pembee.app)
Three pricing tiers: Trial £7, Term Pass £10/class, Drop-In £15/class
No team/staff page beyond founder story on About page
No blog or content marketing present
No visible social media links on website
product_improvement_suggestions: Add social media presence (Instagram is critical for baby/parenting niche)
Launch Active Adventurers and Parties classes to capture older age groups
Add a blog with parenting/sensory development content for SEO
Consider weekend classes for working parents
Add photo gallery or video content showing class environment
Implement referral program to drive word-of-mouth growth

primary_icp: New parents (primarily mothers) of babies and toddlers aged 0-36 months in Farnham and surrounding Surrey/Hampshire areas, seeking developmental activities and community connection.
pain_points: New parents feeling isolated and seeking community
Parents wanting structured developmental activities for babies
Lack of sensory-focused classes in the Farnham area
Parents unsure how to support infant development at home
Need for safe, messy-play environments not possible at home
industry: Children's Education & Activities / Early Years Development
headcount_source: Website analysis (solo founder, no team page, no other staff mentioned)
tech_stack: Custom website (likely Next.js or similar - returns 404 pages with SPA-style routing)

social_presence.notes: No social media presence found for Tiny Whirlwinds. No social links on website. This is a significant gap for a B2C baby/parenting business.

competitors.name: Baby Sensory (Basingstoke, Alton & Farnham)
competitors.differentiation: National franchise with established brand recognition. Covers Farnham area. Award-winning programme.

competitors.name: Lullababy (Aldershot, Farnham & Farnborough)
competitors.differentiation: Offers baby development classes linked to EYFS. Covers sensory play to baby yoga. Established local presence.

competitors.name: Hartbeeps (Farnham area)
competitors.differentiation: National franchise offering multi-sensory classes. Previously operated in Farnham/Wrecclesham but may have closed locally.

competitors.name: Tots Play (Farnham & Alton)
competitors.differentiation: Combines baby signing, yoga, sensory play, massage, and singing in one class. Franchise model.

competitors.name: Vivace Music School (Fleet, Farnham, Yateley)
competitors.differentiation: Music-focused baby classes with sensory elements. Published a comparison article of local sensory classes.

customer_intelligence.persona: First-time mother aged 25-38, on maternity leave, living in Farnham/Surrey area, seeking baby development activities and social connection with other parents.
customer_intelligence.problem: New parents want to support their baby's cognitive and sensory development but lack knowledge, resources, and community. Home environment limits messy/sensory play.
customer_intelligence.validation: Testimonials on website from satisfied parents. 100+ babies served claim. Active booking system with multiple weekly classes.
customer_intelligence.traction: 100+ babies served (website claim). Multiple classes running per week across Mon/Thu/Fri. 5-star parent rating claimed.
customer_intelligence.monetization: Per-class pricing: £7 trial, £10/class term pass, £15 drop-in. Revenue model is recurring term bookings.

enrichment_summary.notes: Very limited external footprint. No Crunchbase, no social media, no press coverage found. Company appears to be a very early-stage local business. Founder identified as Jade McDonough with a tech background (Dexla, University of Surrey) — this is notable as it suggests potential for tech-enabled scaling. LinkedIn profile found but not confirmed as the exact same person (location listed as London on LinkedIn vs Farnham on website, though Surrey/London overlap is common).
